We are looking for an aspiring researcher to join our User Experience Research team. This role involves planning and conducting research on UX design projects that directly impact the experience of millions of users worldwide. We aim to gain a deep understanding of the problems users face and help others develop empathy so we can develop a product that is easy, flexible, and smart. At D2L, UX Research is part of the larger Product Design Team. This means we work closely with Product Designers to inform the design on product initiatives. We get involved early in development projects to conduct research about our users' goals, motivations, and challenges. As designers work through the phases of their projects, we stay deeply engaged and execute usability research to make sure that the final product is meeting our users' needs and expectations. The Product Design Team is part of our larger Technology, Engineering, and Design organization that is responsible for creating and developing all of D2L's products. This means that we collaborate with not only designers, but also Product Managers, Developers, and many other talented D2Lers on our research projects. What you'll get out of working at D2L The D2L User Experience Research team is focused on providing the resources, knowledge, and data that our company needs to make our products easy to use and intuitive. Our team has many areas of expertise including qualitative and quantitative data analysis, usability testing, research planning and design, study facilitation, and more. We conduct research with real users of our software to allow our development teams to make data-informed decisions in their design processes. Our tight-knit team of researchers prioritizes the support and growth of all our team members. We learn from each other to develop the skills to do great work. Joining our team means joining a group that is there for you when you need help and will give you the resources you need to succeed. We believe that co-op terms are not just for work, they are also for growth and learning. What would my main duties be? • Participate in the experimental design process • Collaborate closely with Product Designers and Product Managers • Facilitate moderated UX Research studies • Lead research operations efforts for studies (recruitment, tools, materials, etc.) • Assist with data analysis (qualitative & quantitative) • Communicate research findings to cross-functional teams and leadership Contribute to team meetings and level up colleagues • So, why should you do your co-op at D2L?
